div.div: Results of layer 1: h1ik = max(0, z1ik) = max(0, w1kj.xtrainij + b1j)

switch.text: Results of layer 1: h1ik = max(0, z1ik) = max(0, w1kj.xtrainij + b1j)

div.div: Softmax function h2il=Sl(z2i1, ...z2il'...), to normalize the z2il values so that the output layer are "logits" (i.e. the h2il look like probabilities each between 0 and 1 and sum to 1 for each sample i)

div.div: Output Layer: h2il are the logits, i.e. the probabilities corresponding to each possible category l of the classifier, for each sample i of the training batch

switch.text: Output Layer: h2il are the logits, i.e. the probabilities corresponding to...

div.div: Loss = 1/batchsize * ( - ytrainil . Log h2il ) - average of the 'cross entropy loss' of each sample of the batch. Ytraini is a one-hot encoded vector over the possible categories, for each sample of the training batch
